name: gdal

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: generator
variants.description: the build system generator to use

variants.name: armadillo
variants.description: Speed up computations related to the Thin Plate Spline transformer

variants.name: basisu
variants.description: Required for BASISU and KTX2 drivers

variants.name: expat
variants.description: Required for XML parsing in many OGR drivers

variants.name: geos
variants.description: Required for geometry processing operations in OGR

variants.name: hdf5
variants.description: Required for HDF5, BAG, and KEA drivers

variants.name: kdu
variants.description: Required for JP2KAK and JPIPKAK drivers

variants.name: libxml2
variants.description: Required for XML validation in many OGR drivers

variants.name: oracle
variants.description: Required for OCI and GeoRaster drivers

variants.name: pcre2
variants.description: Required for REGEXP operator in drivers using SQLite3

variants.name: postgresql
variants.description: Required for PostgreSQL and PostGISRaster drivers

variants.name: qhull
variants.description: Used for linear interpolation of gdal_grid

variants.name: spatialite
variants.description: Required for SQLite and GPKG drivers

variants.name: sqlite3
variants.description: Required for SQLite and GPKG drivers

variants.name: teigha
variants.description: Required for DWG and DGNv8 drivers

variants.name: xercesc
variants.description: Required for XML parsing capabilities in many OGR drivers

description:
GDAL: Geospatial Data Abstraction Library. GDAL is a translator library
for raster and vector geospatial data formats that is released under an
MIT style Open Source License by the Open Source Geospatial Foundation.
As a library, it presents a single raster abstract data model and single
vector abstract data model to the calling application for all supported
formats. It also comes with a variety of useful command line utilities
for data translation and processing.

dependencies.name: ant
dependencies.description:
Apache Ant is a Java library and command-line tool whose mission is to
drive processes described in build files as targets and extension points
dependent upon each other

dependencies.name: armadillo
dependencies.description:
Armadillo is a high quality linear algebra library (matrix maths) for
the C++ language, aiming towards a good balance between speed and ease
of use.

dependencies.name: arrow
dependencies.description:
A cross-language development platform for in-memory data. This package
contains the C++ bindings.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
Intel oneAPI Math Kernel Library (Intel oneMKL; formerly Intel Math
Kernel Library or Intel MKL), is a library of optimized math routines
for science, engineering, and financial applications. Core math
functions include BLAS, LAPACK, ScaLAPACK, sparse solvers, fast Fourier
transforms, and vector math. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and
using this software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the
software license agreements at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: brunsli
dependencies.description: Brunsli is a lossless JPEG repacking library.

dependencies.name: c-blosc
dependencies.description: Blosc, an extremely fast, multi-threaded, meta-compressor library

dependencies.name: cfitsio
dependencies.description:
CFITSIO is a library of C and Fortran subroutines for reading and
writing data files in FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) data
format.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: crunch
dependencies.description: Advanced DXTc texture compression and transcoding library.

dependencies.name: cryptopp
dependencies.description:
Crypto++ is an open-source C++ library of cryptographic schemes. The
library supports a number of different cryptography algorithms,
including authenticated encryption schemes (GCM, CCM), hash functions
(SHA-1, SHA2), public-key encryption (RSA, DSA), and a few
obsolete/historical encryption algorithms (MD5, Panama).

dependencies.name: curl
dependencies.description:
cURL is an open source command line tool and library for transferring
data with URL syntax

dependencies.name: expat
dependencies.description: Expat is an XML parser library written in C.

dependencies.name: freexl
dependencies.description:
FreeXL is an open source library to extract valid data from within an
Excel (.xls) spreadsheet.

dependencies.name: fyba
dependencies.description:
OpenFYBA is the source code release of the FYBA library, distributed by
the National Mapping Authority of Norway (Statens kartverk) to read and
write files in the National geodata standard format SOSI.

dependencies.name: geos
dependencies.description:
GEOS (Geometry Engine, Open Source). GEOS is a C/C++ library for
computational geometry with a focus on algorithms used in geographic
information systems (GIS) software. It implements the OGC Simple
Features geometry model and provides all the spatial functions in that
standard as well as many others. GEOS is a core dependency of PostGIS,
QGIS, GDAL, and Shapely.

dependencies.name: giflib
dependencies.description:
The GIFLIB project maintains the giflib service library, which has been
pulling images out of GIFs since 1989.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: googletest
dependencies.description: Google test framework for C++. Also called gtest.

dependencies.name: grass
dependencies.description:
GRASS GIS (Geographic Resources Analysis Support System), is a free and
open source Geographic Information System (GIS) software suite used for
geospatial data management and analysis, image processing, graphics and
maps production, spatial modeling, and visualization.

dependencies.name: grib-api
dependencies.description:
The ECMWF GRIB API is an application program interface accessible from
C, FORTRAN and Python programs developed for encoding and decoding WMO
FM-92 GRIB edition 1 and edition 2 messages. The API was deprecated
https://www.ecmwf.int/en/newsletter/152/news/end-road-grib-api in favor
of ecCodes.

dependencies.name: hadoop
dependencies.description:
The Apache Hadoop software library is a framework that allows for the
distributed processing of large data sets across clusters of computers
using simple programming models.

dependencies.name: hdf
dependencies.description:
HDF4 (also known as HDF) is a library and multi-object file format for
storing and managing data between machines.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: iconv
dependencies.description: Dummy package to provide interfaces available in libc.

dependencies.name: jackcess
dependencies.description:
Jackcess is a pure Java library for reading from and writing to MS
Access databases (currently supporting versions 2000-2016).

dependencies.name: jasper
dependencies.description: Library for manipulating JPEG-2000 images

dependencies.name: java
dependencies.description:
The Java Development Kit (JDK) released by Oracle Corporation in the
form of a binary product aimed at Java developers. Includes a complete
JRE plus tools for developing, debugging, and monitoring Java
applications.

dependencies.name: jpeg
dependencies.description:
MozJPEG is a patched version of libjpeg-turbo which improves JPEG
compression efficiency achieving higher visual quality and smaller file
sizes at the same time

dependencies.name: json-c
dependencies.description: A JSON implementation in C.

dependencies.name: kealib
dependencies.description:
An HDF5 Based Raster File Format. KEALib provides an implementation of
the GDAL data model. The format supports raster attribute tables, image
pyramids, meta-data and in-built statistics while also handling very
large files and compression throughout. Based on the HDF5 standard, it
also provides a base from which other formats can be derived and is a
good choice for long term data archiving. An independent software
library (libkea) provides complete access to the KEA image format and a
GDAL driver allowing KEA images to be used from any GDAL supported
software. Development work on this project has been funded by Landcare
Research.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description:
Intel oneAPI Math Kernel Library (Intel oneMKL; formerly Intel Math
Kernel Library or Intel MKL), is a library of optimized math routines
for science, engineering, and financial applications. Core math
functions include BLAS, LAPACK, ScaLAPACK, sparse solvers, fast Fourier
transforms, and vector math. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and
using this software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the
software license agreements at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: lerc
dependencies.description:
Limited Error Raster Compression. LERC is an open-source image or raster
format which supports rapid encoding and decoding for any pixel type
(not just RGB or Byte). Users set the maximum compression error per
pixel while encoding, so the precision of the original input image is
preserved (within user defined error bounds).

dependencies.name: libaec
dependencies.description:
Libaec provides fast lossless compression of 1 up to 32 bit wide signed
or unsigned integers (samples). It implements Golomb-Rice compression
method under the BSD license and includes a free drop-in replacement for
the SZIP library.

dependencies.name: libarchive
dependencies.description:
libarchive: C library and command-line tools for reading and writing
tar, cpio, zip, ISO, and other archive formats.

dependencies.name: libdeflate
dependencies.description:
Heavily optimized library for DEFLATE/zlib/gzip compression and
decompression

dependencies.name: libgeotiff
dependencies.description:
GeoTIFF represents an effort by over 160 different remote sensing, GIS,
cartographic, and surveying related companies and organizations to
establish a TIFF based interchange format for georeferenced raster
imagery.

dependencies.name: libgta
dependencies.description: Library that reads and writes Generic Tagged Arrays (GTA) files.

dependencies.name: libheif
dependencies.description: libheif is an HEIF and AVIF file format decoder and encoder.

dependencies.name: libjxl
dependencies.description: JPEG XL image format reference implementation.

dependencies.name: libkml
dependencies.description: Reference implementation of OGC KML 2.2.

dependencies.name: libpng
dependencies.description: libpng is the official PNG reference library.

dependencies.name: libspatialite
dependencies.description:
SpatiaLite is an open source library intended to extend the SQLite core
to support fully fledged Spatial SQL capabilities.

dependencies.name: libtiff
dependencies.description: LibTIFF - Tag Image File Format (TIFF) Library and Utilities.

dependencies.name: libwebp
dependencies.description:
WebP is a modern image format that provides superior lossless and lossy
compression for images on the web. Using WebP, webmasters and web
developers can create smaller, richer images that make the web faster.

dependencies.name: libxml2
dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.

dependencies.name: lz4
dependencies.description:
LZ4 is lossless compression algorithm, providing compression speed at
400 MB/s per core, scalable with multi-cores CPU. It also features an
extremely fast decoder, with speed in multiple GB/s per core, typically
reaching RAM speed limits on multi-core systems.

dependencies.name: mongo-cxx-driver
dependencies.description: C++ Driver for MongoDB

dependencies.name: mysql
dependencies.description: MySQL is an open source relational database management system.

dependencies.name: netcdf-c
dependencies.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the C distribution.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: opencl
dependencies.description:
Portable Computing Language (pocl) is an open source implementation of
the OpenCL standard which can be easily adapted for new targets and
devices, both for homogeneous CPU and heterogeneous GPUs/accelerators.

dependencies.name: openexr
dependencies.description: OpenEXR Graphics Tools (high dynamic-range image file format)

dependencies.name: openjpeg
dependencies.description:
OpenJPEG is an open-source JPEG 2000 codec written in C language. It has
been developed in order to promote the use of JPEG 2000, a still-image
compression standard from the Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG).
Since April 2015, it is officially recognized by ISO/IEC and ITU-T as a
JPEG 2000 Reference Software.

dependencies.name: openssl
dependencies.description:
OpenSSL is an open source project that provides a robust, commercial-
grade, and full-featured toolkit for the Transport Layer Security (TLS)
and Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocols. It is also a general-purpose
cryptography library.

dependencies.name: oracle-instant-client
dependencies.description: Oracle instant client

dependencies.name: parquet-cpp
dependencies.description: C++ bindings for the Apache Parquet columnar data format.

dependencies.name: pcre
dependencies.description:
The PCRE package contains Perl Compatible Regular Expression libraries.
These are useful for implementing regular expression pattern matching
using the same syntax and semantics as Perl 5.

dependencies.name: pcre2
dependencies.description:
The PCRE2 package contains Perl Compatible Regular Expression libraries.
These are useful for implementing regular expression pattern matching
using the same syntax and semantics as Perl 5.

dependencies.name: perl
dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: php
dependencies.description:
PHP is a popular general-purpose scripting language that is especially
suited to web development. Fast, flexible and pragmatic, PHP powers
everything from your blog to the most popular websites in the world.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.

dependencies.name: poppler
dependencies.description: Poppler is a PDF rendering library based on the xpdf-3.0 code base.

dependencies.name: postgresql
dependencies.description:
PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system.
It has more than 15 years of active development and a proven
architecture that has earned it a strong reputation for reliability,
data integrity, and correctness.

dependencies.name: proj
dependencies.description:
PROJ is a generic coordinate transformation software, that transforms
geospatial coordinates from one coordinate reference system (CRS) to
another. This includes cartographic projections as well as geodetic
transformations.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: qb3
dependencies.description: QB3: Fast and Efficient Raster Compression.

dependencies.name: qhull
dependencies.description:
Qhull computes the convex hull, Delaunay triangulation, Voronoi diagram,
halfspace intersection about a point, furt hest-site Delaunay
triangulation, and furthest-site Voronoi diagram. The source code runs
in 2-d, 3-d, 4-d, and higher dimensions. Qhull implements the Quickhull
algorithm for computing the convex hull. It handles roundoff errors from
floating point arithmetic. It computes volumes, surface areas, and
approximations to the convex hull.

dependencies.name: sfcgal
dependencies.description:
SFCGAL is a C++ wrapper library around CGAL with the aim of supporting
ISO 19107:2013 and OGC Simple Features Access 1.2 for 3D operations.
SFCGAL provides standard compliant geometry types and operations, that
can be accessed from its C or C++ APIs.

dependencies.name: sqlite
dependencies.description:
SQLite is a C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-
contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine.

dependencies.name: swig
dependencies.description:
SWIG is an interface compiler that connects programs written in C and
C++ with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby, and Tcl. It
works by taking the declarations found in C/C++ header files and using
them to generate the wrapper code that scripting languages need to
access the underlying C/C++ code. In addition, SWIG provides a variety
of customization features that let you tailor the wrapping process to
suit your application.

dependencies.name: unixodbc
dependencies.description:
ODBC is an open specification for providing application developers with
a predictable API with which to access Data Sources. Data Sources
include SQL Servers and any Data Source with an ODBC Driver.

dependencies.name: xerces-c
dependencies.description:
Xerces-C++ is a validating XML parser written in a portable subset of
C++. Xerces-C++ makes it easy to give your application the ability to
read and write XML data. A shared library is provided for parsing,
generating, manipulating, and validating XML documents using the DOM,
SAX, and SAX2 APIs.

dependencies.name: xz
dependencies.description:
XZ Utils is free general-purpose data compression software with high
compression ratio. XZ Utils were written for POSIX-like systems, but
also work on some not-so-POSIX systems. XZ Utils are the successor to
LZMA Utils.

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.

dependencies.name: zstd
dependencies.description:
Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression
algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and
better compression ratios.

dependent_to.name: sumo
dependent_to.description:
Eclipse SUMO is an open source, highly portable, microscopic and
continuous road traffic simulation package designed to handle large road
networks. It allows for intermodal simulation including pedestrians and
comes with a large set of tools for scenario creation.

dependent_to.name: py-wradlib
dependent_to.description:
wradlib is designed to assist you in the most important steps of
processing weather radar data. These may include: reading common data
formats, georeferencing, converting reflectivity to rainfall intensity,
identifying and correcting typical error sources (such as clutter or
attenuation) and visualising the data.

dependent_to.name: r-gdalutils
dependent_to.description: Wrappers for the Geospatial Data Abstraction Library (GDAL) Utilities.

dependent_to.name: py-torchgeo
dependent_to.description:
TorchGeo: datasets, samplers, transforms, and pre-trained models for
geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: r-terra
dependent_to.description:
Spatial Data Analysis. Methods for spatial data analysis with raster and
vector data. Raster methods allow for low-level data manipulation as
well as high-level global, local, zonal, and focal computation. The
predict and interpolate methods facilitate the use of regression type
(interpolation, machine learning) models for spatial prediction,
including with satellite remote sensing data. Processing of very large
files is supported. See the manual and tutorials on
<https://rspatial.org/terra/> to get started. 'terra' is very similar to
the 'raster' package; but 'terra' can do more, is easier to use, and it
is faster.

dependent_to.name: qgis
dependent_to.description:
QGIS is a free and open-source cross-platform desktop geographic
information system application that supports viewing, editing, and
analysis of geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: r-rgdal
dependent_to.description:
Bindings for the 'Geospatial' Data Abstraction Library. Provides
bindings to the 'Geospatial' Data Abstraction Library ('GDAL') (>=
1.11.4) and access to projection/transformation operations from the
'PROJ' library. Use is made of classes defined in the 'sp' package.
Raster and vector map data can be imported into R, and raster and vector
'sp' objects exported. The 'GDAL' and 'PROJ' libraries are external to
the package, and, when installing the package from source, must be
correctly installed first; it is important that 'GDAL' < 3 be matched
with 'PROJ' < 6. From 'rgdal' 1.5-8, installed with to 'GDAL' >=3,
'PROJ' >=6 and 'sp' >= 1.4, coordinate reference systems use 'WKT2_2019'
strings, not 'PROJ' strings. 'Windows' and 'macOS' binaries (including
'GDAL', 'PROJ' and their dependencies) are provided on 'CRAN'.

dependent_to.name: postgis
dependent_to.description:
PostGIS is a spatial database extender for PostgreSQL object-relational
database. It adds support for geographic objects allowing location
queries to be run in SQL

dependent_to.name: ncl
dependent_to.description:
NCL is an interpreted language designed specifically for scientific data
analysis and visualization. Supports NetCDF 3/4, GRIB 1/2, HDF 4/5, HDF-
EOD 2/5, shapefile, ASCII, binary. Numerous analysis functions are
built-in.

dependent_to.name: py-anuga
dependent_to.description:
ANUGA (pronounced "AHnooGAH") is open-source software for the simulation
of the shallow water equation, in particular it can be used to model
tsunamis and floods.

dependent_to.name: opencv
dependent_to.description:
OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) is an open source computer
vision and machine learning software library.

dependent_to.name: gmt
dependent_to.description:
GMT (Generic Mapping Tools) is an open source collection of about 80
command-line tools for manipulating geographic and Cartesian data sets
(including filtering, trend fitting, gridding, projecting, etc.) and
producing PostScript illustrations ranging from simple x-y plots via
contour maps to artificially illuminated surfaces and 3D perspective
views.

dependent_to.name: py-python-fmask
dependent_to.description:
A set of command line utilities and Python modules that implement the
FMASK algorithm for Landsat and Sentinel-2

dependent_to.name: gplates
dependent_to.description:
GPlates is desktop software for the interactive visualisation of plate
tectonics. GPlates offers a novel combination of interactive plate
tectonic reconstructions, geographic information system (GIS)
functionality and raster data visualisation. GPlates enables both the
visualisation and the manipulation of plate tectonic reconstructions and
associated data through geological time.

dependent_to.name: py-arm-pyart
dependent_to.description:
Python ARM Radar Toolkit. A growing collection of weather radar
algorithms and utilities build on top of the Scientific Python stack and
distributed under the 3-Clause BSD license. Py-ART is used by the
Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) Climate Research Facility for
working with data from a number of precipitation and cloud radars, but
has been designed so that it can be used by others in the radar and
atmospheric communities to examine, processes, and analyse data from
many types of weather radars.

dependent_to.name: mapserver
dependent_to.description:
MapServer is an Open Source geographic data rendering engine written in
C. Beyond browsing GIS data, MapServer allows you create "geographic
image maps", that is, maps that can direct users to content

dependent_to.name: py-pynio
dependent_to.description:
PyNIO ("pie-nee-oh") is a Python module that allows read and/or write
access to a variety of scientific data formats popular in climate and
weather

dependent_to.name: liblas
dependent_to.description:
libLAS is a C/C++ library for reading and writing the very common LAS
LiDAR format.

dependent_to.name: py-rasterio
dependent_to.description:
Rasterio reads and writes geospatial raster data. Geographic information
systems use GeoTIFF and other formats to organize and store gridded, or
raster, datasets. Rasterio reads and writes these formats and provides a
Python API based on N-D arrays.

dependent_to.name: r-sf
dependent_to.description:
Simple Features for R. Support for simple features, a standardized way
to encode spatial vector data. Binds to 'GDAL' for reading and writing
data, to 'GEOS' for geometrical operations, and to 'PROJ' for projection
conversions and datum transformations. Optionally uses the 's2' package
for spherical geometry operations on geographic coordinates.

dependent_to.name: grass
dependent_to.description:
GRASS GIS (Geographic Resources Analysis Support System), is a free and
open source Geographic Information System (GIS) software suite used for
geospatial data management and analysis, image processing, graphics and
maps production, spatial modeling, and visualization.

dependent_to.name: openscenegraph
dependent_to.description:
OpenSceneGraph is an open source, high performance 3D graphics toolkit
that's used in a variety of visual simulation applications.

dependent_to.name: py-fiona
dependent_to.description: Fiona reads and writes spatial data files.

dependent_to.name: py-tuiview
dependent_to.description:
TuiView is a lightweight raster GIS with powerful raster attribute table
manipulation abilities.

dependent_to.name: py-pygdal
dependent_to.description:
Virtualenv and setuptools friendly version of standard GDAL python
bindings. This package is for you if you had problems installing GDAL in
your virtualenv. You can install GDAL into your virtualenv using this
package but you still need to install GDAL library and its header files
on your system.

dependent_to.name: py-cartopy
dependent_to.description: Cartopy - a cartographic python library with matplotlib support.

dependent_to.name: py-rios
dependent_to.description:
Raster I/O Simplification. A set of python modules which makes it easy
to write raster processing code in Python. Built on top of GDAL, it
handles the details of opening and closing files, checking alignment of
projection and raster grid, stepping through the raster in small blocks,
etc., allowing the programmer to concentrate on the processing involved.

dependent_to.name: mapnik
dependent_to.description:
mapnik combines pixel-perfect image output with lightning-fast
cartographic algorithms, and exposes interfaces in C++, Python, and Node

dependent_to.name: pktools
dependent_to.description: Processing Kernel for geospatial data

dependent_to.name: saga-gis
dependent_to.description:
SAGA is a GIS for Automated Geoscientific Analyses and has been
designed for an easy and effective implementation of spatial algorithms.
It offers a comprehensive, growing set of geoscientific methods and
provides an easily approachable user interface with many visualisation
options
